PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY MEDICINE   WRIGHT STATE UNIVERSITY BOONSHOFT SCHOOL OF MEDICINE   725 UNIVERSITY BLVD   FAIRBORN, OH  45324   PROJECT DIRECTOR: PETER L. REYNOLDS, MD, MBA   VOICE: 937-775-2425   FAX: 937-245-7931   FAMILY_PRACTICE@PREMIERHEALTH.COM   HTTPS://MEDICINE.WRIGHT.EDU/FAMILY-MEDICINE/FAMILY-MEDICINE-RESIDENCY-PROGRAM   FUNDING REQUESTED: $2,281,498  THE PROGRAM AUGMENTING RESIDENT TRAINING FOR NEEDS IN THE EMOTIONAL REALM (PARTNER) PROJECT WILL INTENSIFY THE TRAINING OF WRIGHT STATE UNIVERSITY BOONSHOFT SCHOOL OF MEDICINE (BSOM) FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS TO CARE FOR THE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH NEEDS OF CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED WITH TWO PRIMARY MODIFICATIONS IN THE CURRENT CURRICULUM. FIRST, TWO WEEKS OF CURRENT 4-WEEK ROTATIONS IN SCHOOL HEALTH AND COMMUNITY HEALTH, RESPECTIVELY, WILL BE DEVOTED TO TRAINING IN YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULT MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH. THIS WILL INCLUDE NEW TRAINING EXPERIENCES IN THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SECTIONS OF A CHILDREN’S HOSPITAL, THE STUDENT HEALTH CENTER OF A HISTORICALLY BLACK COLLEGE OR UNIVERSITY, AND IN THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES OF A RURAL FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER. SECOND, THE DIDACTICS SERIES OF THE RESIDENCY CURRICULUM WILL BE MODIFIED TO INCLUDE AT LEAST ONE SESSION EACH MONTH DEVOTED TO CHILD, ADOLESCENT, OR YOUNG ADULT MENTAL OR BEHAVIORAL HEALTH. THESE OBJECTIVES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY ESTABLISHING NEW TRAINING EXPERIENCES FOR RESIDENTS WITH BOTH NEW AND EXISTING COMMUNITY PARTNERS, AND LEVERAGING THE EXPERTISE OF FACULTY IN THE BSOM DEPARTMENTS OF PEDIATRICS AND PSYCHIATRY.  THE THREE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES OF THIS PROJECT ARE: 1)	TRAIN A MINIMUM OF 60 WRIGHT STATE UNIVERSITY BOONSHOFT SCHOOL OF MEDICINE FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS BY SEPTEMBER 2027. 2)	DEVELOP OR EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS WITH INTEGRATED BEHAVIOR AL HEALTH AND PRIMARY CARE SETTINGS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS BY JULY 2023 TO PROVIDE CLINICAL ROTATIONS FOR AT LEAST ONE MONTH IN DURATION FOR BSOM FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS. 3)	DEVELOP OR ENHANCE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONTENT IN DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL TRAINING FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS INCLUDING SUICIDE PREVENTION, TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE, AND THE EFFECTS OF ABUSE AND GUN VIOLENCE, ENSURING ALL MATERIALS ARE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT, BY JULY 2024.  THE BSOM FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAM DIRECTOR WILL SERVE AS PROJECT DIRECTOR, AND THE CO-PROJECT DIRECTOR WILL BE THE BSOM ASSOCIATE DIRECTOR OF RESEARCH AFFAIRS, A PSYCHOLOGIST WITH YEARS OF EXPERIENCE AS A RESIDENCY FACULTY MEMBER. BOTH INDIVIDUALS HAVE SUCCESSFULLY MANAGED LARGE FEDERAL GRANTS. THEY HAVE ASSEMBLED A TEAM OF FACULTY AND STAFF WITH THE EXPERIENCE NECESSARY TO ACCOMPLISH THE PROJECT, SECURED RELATIONSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY PARTNERS, AND HAVE OUTLINED AN ATTAINABLE PLAN WITH ACHIEVABLE GOALS.  THE PROJECT IS FOCUSED ON FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS, MANY OF WHOM ARE EXPECTED TO PROVIDE PRIMARY CARE TO OHIO AND NEIGHBORING REGIONS WHO PRESENTLY ARE CLASSIFIED AS BEING PRIMARY CARE OF MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL SHORTAGE AREAS (HPSAS). A FUNDING PREFERENCE IS BEING REQUESTED AS 72.7% OF 2020-21 GRADUATES ARE PROVIDING MEDICAL CARE IN PRIMARY CARE AND/OR MENTAL HEALTH HPSAS AND 90.9% OF 2021-22 GRADS ARE PROVIDING MEDICAL CARE IN PRIMARY CARE AND/OR MENTAL HEALTH HPSAS.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - WESTERN MICHIGAN UNIVERSITY, HOMER STRYKER, MD, SCHOOL OF MEDICINE 1000 OAKLAND DRIVE KALAMAZOO, MI 49008 DR. JOCELYN DELEON, PROJECT DIRECTOR 269.337.4400 (PHONE) HTTPS://MED.WMICH.EDU/ REQUESTED AMOUNT OF FUNDS: $2,476,942  PROJECT ABSTRACT  OVERVIEW 	THE PEDIATRIC & ADOLESCENT MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAM IS SEEKING GRANT FUNDING TO ENHANCE OUR RESIDENTS TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH.  WESTERN MICHIGAN UNIVERSITY, HOMER STRYKER, MD, SCHOOL OF MEDICINE IS A NEWER MEDICAL LOCATED IN KALAMAZOO MICHIGAN WHICH IS HOME TO MANY DISADVANTAGED CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS WHO ARE PATIENTS IN OUR PRIMARY CARE CLINICS.  OUR RESIDENTS COME FROM AROUND THE WORLD WITH VARYING AMOUNTS OF TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH.  OUR CURRENT ABILITY TO TRAIN OUR RESIDENTS THOROUGHLY IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH IS LIMITED FOR A NUMBER OF REASONS.  OUR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH STAFF ALL HAVE VERY LONG WAIT LISTS DUE TO UNDERSTAFFING WHICH MAKES IT CHALLENGING TO DEVOTE RESOURCES TO TEACHING RESIDENTS.  GRANT FUNDING WOULD ALLOW US TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES, DEVELOP DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL TRAINING PROGRAMS FOR RESIDENTS AND GENERAL PEDIATRIC PEDIATRICIANS, AND EXPAND OUR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH STAFF TO ALLOW FOR ADDITIONAL TEACHING AND CLINICAL RESPONSIBILITIES.  BECAUSE OF THIS GRANT OUR RESIDENCY PROGRAM WILL BE ABLE TO TRAIN UP TO 60 RESIDENTS MANY OF WHICH WILL ULTIMATELY BE EMPLOYED IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES THUS PROVIDING IMPROVED OUTCOMES.  OBJECTIVES  	OBJECTIVES TO ENHANCE OUR TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIOR HEALTH INCLUDE; INCREASING THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS TRAINED IN PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS; EXPANDING AND DEVELOP PARTNERSHIPS TO PROVIDE CLINICAL ROTATIONS; AND DEVELOP AND ENHANCE MENTAL DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL TRAINING FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS INCLUDING SUICIDE PREVENTION, TRAUMA INFORMED CARE INC LUDING ABUSE AND GUN VIOLENCE; MATERIALS MUST BE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT. METHODS 	OUR OBJECTIVES WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED ENHANCING OUR CLINICAL AND DIDACTIC TRAINING EXPERIENCES, CREATING A MONTH-LONG MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ROTATION WHICH INCLUDES SITES WITHIN OUR PROGRAM AND A VARIETY OF EXTERNAL SITES.  IN ADDITION, WE PLAN TO START A COLLABORATIVE ADHD CLINIC SPECIFICALLY FOR TEACHING RESIDENTS, DEVELOP A CURRICULUM/TRAINING FOR OUR GENERAL PEDIATRIC PEDIATRICIANS, AND SET UP FORMAL RESIDENT OBSERVATIONS IN COMMUNICATION AND INTERPERSONAL COMMUNICATION.  WE ARE SETTING UP PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE WMU RESILIENCY CENTER AS WELL AS WITH OUR CURRENT CHILD ABUSE ROTATION TO PROVIDE SPECIFIC TRAINING IN TRAUMA INFORMED CARE AND CARE THAT IS CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE. WE WILL ALSO WORK WITH THE DIVISION OF PEDIATRIC PSYCHOLOGY UTILIZING PARTS OF THEIR CURRICULUM AND FACULTY TO ASSIST WITH IMPLEMENTING A NEW RESIDENCY TRAINING PROGRAM IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH.  LASTLY, WE HAVE DEVELOPED A COMPREHENSIVE EVALUATION PROCEDURE TO MEASURE HOW PROGRESS TOWARD OUR GOALS AND OBJECTIVES. REQUESTED FUNDING PREFERENCE   	OUR PROGRAM IS REQUESTING A FUNDING PREFERENCE UNDER QUALIFICATION 1: HIGH MUC PLACEMENT RATE. PLEASE SEE ATTACHMENT 7.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - VALLEY HEALTH TEAM, INC., A FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER, SPONSORS ITS 36-MONTH FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAM (VHTFMRP). ALL OF VHTFMRP’S TRAINING SITES ARE LOCATED IN UNDERSERVED AREAS, AND ALL RESIDENTS SPEND ASSIGNED ROTATIONS IN BOTH URBAN AND RURAL COMMUNITIES. THE PROGRAM IS DESIGNED TO PREPARE RESIDENTS FOR THE UNIQUE ASPECTS OF PROVIDING CARE TO THE UNDERSERVED AND EMPHASIZES THE IMPORTANCE OF INCREASING ACCESS FOR THESE COMMUNITIES. CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT AND EVALUATION WILL ENSURE THE PROJECT MEETS THE EXPECTED GOALS AND RESPONDS TO CHALLENGES ALONG THE WAY.  UNDER THIS ENHANCEMENT PROJECT, VHT WILL EXPAND VHTFMRP TRAINING TO INCLUDE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS (SUD) FOR PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT, YOUNG ADULT AND OTHER HIGH-RISK POPULATIONS, COLLECTIVELY REFERRED TO AS YOUNG PATIENTS.  OBJECTIVES 1) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS WHO ARE TRAINED IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL/BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS AND SUBSTANCE/OPIOID USE DISORDERS; 2) DEVELOP AND EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS WITH INTEGRATED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND PRIMARY CARE SETTINGS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE CLINICAL ROTATIONS FOR AT LEAST ONE MONTH IN DURATION FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS; AND 3) DEVELOP OR ENHANCE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONTENT IN DIDACTIC TRAINING FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS INCLUDING SUICIDE PREVENTION, TRAUMA INFORMED CARE INCLUDING ABUSE AND GUN VIOLENCE; MATERIALS WILL BE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT, AND WILL EMPHASIZE PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT AND YOUNG ADULT POPULATION. STEP 1: STRENGTH VHTFMRP’S OVERALL BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CURRICULUM BY WORKING MORE CLOSELY WITH THE VHT BEHAVIORAL HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND EXPANDING OUR PROGRAM REACH BEYOND VHT. VHT’S BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROVIDERS WILL ALSO WORK WITH FACULTY TO IDENTIFY EDUCATIONAL  NEEDS AND FACULTY WILL DEVELOP THE ENHANCED DIDACTIC CURRICULUM; CONSULTANTS AND PARTNERS WILL DELIVER TRAINING AND OTHER DIDACTICS. WE PLAN TO CONTINUE EXPANDING OUR RESIDENCY FROM A COMPLEMENT OF 12 (4-4-4) TO A COMPLEMENT OF 18 (6-6-6).  LASTLY, VHT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING OTHER LOCAL PRIMARY CARE PROVIDERS AND FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCIES.  STEP 2: VHT’S RESIDENCY PROGRAM WILL CREATE AND CONDUCT NEW CLINICAL ROTATION EXPERIENCES, INCLUDING A MONTH-LONG ROTATION DURING SENIOR YEAR(S) IN TRAINING FOR FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS.  VHT OFFERS BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES AT EVERY CLINICAL SITE AND HAS CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROVIDERS WHO ARE ABLE TO DELIVER THERAPEUTIC SERVICES TO PATIENTS OF ALL AGES, INCLUDING CHILDREN.  THIS VALUABLE ASSET WILL BE LEVERAGED TO AUGMENT THE RESIDENTS’ CLINICAL LEARNING EXPERIENCES.   VHT PLANS TO INCORPORATE PATIENT NAVIGATORS INTO THE RESIDENCY’S TRAINING REALM.  QUALITY IMPROVEMENT STUDIES CONDUCTED BY VHTFMRP OVER THE LAST FEW YEARS HAVE REVEALED THE BENEFITS THESE ADDITIONAL COMPONENTS PROVIDE.  RESIDENTS ARE MORE INCLINED TO SCREEN PATIENTS WHEN THEY CAN REFER/LINK PATIENTS TO NEEDED SERVICES.  STEP 3: ADDITIONAL TRAINING TIME WILL BE DEDICATED TO DIDACTIC SESSIONS IN THIS CURRICULAR REALM. THIS INCLUDES CLINICAL ENHANCEMENTS AND DIDACTIC COMPONENTS.  OUR FAMILY MEDICINE FACULTY WILL BECOME A PERPETUAL RESOURCE TO PROVIDE STRONGER BEHAVIORAL HEALTH TRAINING BY BECOMING PRIMARY CARE PSYCHIATRY FELLOWSHIP TRAINED.  OUTSIDE CONSULTATIVE SERVICES WILL SUPPLEMENT THE EXPERTISE CONTAINED WITHIN OUR INSTITUTION; THESE SERVICES WILL BE USED FOR HANDS-ON SKILLS TRAININGS FOR PROVIDING BRIEF THERAPY SESSIONS AND HIGHLY SPECIALIZED SESSIONS.  WE WILL ALSO AVAIL OURSELVES OF HIGH-QUALITY FREE RESOURCES, LIKE ACES AWARE AND ECHO PROJECTS FROM THE WEITZMAN INSTITUTE, TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL.  MEDICAL RESIDENCY SPECIALTIES INCLUDE FAMILY MEDICINE. VHT IS REQUESTING AND MEETS FUNDING PREFERENCE AND PRIORITY QUALIFICA TIONS.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - APPLICANT ORGANIZATION NAME AND ADDRESS: UNIVERSITY OF UTAH, 75 S 2000 E, SALT LAKE CITY, UT 84112-8930 PROJECT DIRECTOR AND CONTACT INFORMATION: SUSAN COCHELLA, MD, MPH; VOICE 801-581-7234, FAX 801- 581-2759, EMAIL SUSAN.COCHELLA @HSC.UTAH.EDU TOTAL GRANT FUNDS REQUESTED: $2,490,499 REQUEST FOR FUNDING PREFERENCE OR PRIORITY: (1) FUNDING PRIORITY BASED ON TRAINING OF RESIDENTS IN RURAL SITES; (2) FUNDING PREFERENCE BASED ON PLACEMENT OF GRADUATES IN MUCS  MENTAL HEALTH IS A SERIOUS ISSUE FOR VULNERABLE AND UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS IN UTAH, A STATE CHARACTERIZED BY A YOUNG POPULATION, A HIGH PERCENTAGE OF RURAL AREAS, AND A GROWING POPULATION OF LGBTQ+, NEW AMERICAN/REFUGEE, AND RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITY COMMUNITIES. SUICIDE IS THE LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH IN UTAHNS AGES 15-24, WITH A DISPROPORTIONATELY HIGH RATE OF SUICIDE BY FIREARMS (85% IN UTAH VS 60% IN THE US IN 2017). ACCESS TO CARE IS CHALLENGING IN UTAH’S RURAL AREAS, WHERE ONLY A FEW PRIMARY CARE PROVIDERS, OFTEN FAMILY MEDICINE PHYSICIANS, PRACTICE, AND MAJOR GEOGRAPHIC FEATURES DISRUPT TRAVEL, FURTHER IMPACTING ACCESS TO HEALTHCARE FACILITIES. OUR PROJECT AIMS TO IMPROVE THE ACCESS TO MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES BY SUBSTANTIALLY STRENGTHENING COMPETENCIES OF FAMILY MEDICINE PHYSICIANS, IN PARTICULAR FOCUSING ON VULNERABLE AND UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS. IN SUPPORT OF THIS OVERALL OBJECTIVE, WE HAVE THREE GOALS: 1. INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS WHO ARE TRAINED IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS. WE WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT A CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY LONGITUDINAL-INTEGRATED CURRICULA FOR MENTAL HEALTH TRAINING ACROSS DIDACTICS, ROTATIONS, AND RESIDENCY YEARS. BY THE END OF THIS PROJECT, 80 FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS WILL BE TRAINED BASED ON THIS CURRICULUM. 2. DEVELOP OR EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS WITH INTEGRATED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, PRIMARY CARE SETTINGS AND COMMUNITY-BASED OR GANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE CLINICAL ROTATIONS FOR AT LEAST ONE MONTH IN DURATION FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS. ACCOMPLISHING THIS GOAL WILL RESULT IN AN EXPANDED RANGE OF PARTNERSHIPS FOR THE FAMILY MEDICINE, PROVIDING INCREASED CAPACITY FOR ROTATIONS TO SUPPORT MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH IN CHILDREN, FAMILIES, AND VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. 9 NEW PARTNERSHIPS WILL BE DEVELOPED, AND 4 WILL BE ENHANCED. 3. DEVELOP OR ENHANCE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONTENT IN DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL TRAINING FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS INCLUDING SUICIDE PREVENTION, TRAUMA INFORMED CARE INCLUDING ABUSE AND GUN VIOLENCE; MATERIALS MUST BE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT. BY REACHING THIS GOAL, FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS WILL HAVE 6 MONTHS OF MANDATORY BLOCK ROTATIONS AND 3 MONTHS OF ELECTIVE ROTATIONS TO TRAIN AND PRACTICE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH IN INTEGRATED SETTINGS. BY INCORPORATING BOTH DIDACTIC CONTENT AND SUPERVISED CLINICAL EXPERIENCE IN MULTIPLE SETTINGS, OUR PROPOSAL ADDRESSES THE FOLLOWING HRSA STRATEGIC OBJECTIVES (SELECTED): 1. MAXIMIZE COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND STAKEHOLDER COLLABORATION, INCLUDING THOSE WHO HAVE HISTORICALLY EXPERIENCED HEALTH DISPARITIES 2. REDUCE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CHALLENGES BY SUPPORTING AVAILABILITY, ACCESSIBILITY, AND EFFECTIVENESS OF SERVICES

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - UNC DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY MEDICINE  590 MANNING DRIVE CB 7595, CHAPEL HILL, NC 27599  PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR: MALLORY M. BROWN, MD  PHONE: 984-974-4649; EMAIL: MALLORY_MCCLESTER@MED.UNC.EDU  PROJECT DIRECTOR: MICHAEL BACA-ATLAS, MD  PHONE: +1 (610) 533-5308; EMAIL: MICHAEL_BACA-ATLAS@MED.UNC.EDU   FUNDS REQUESTED: $2,423,355   THE UNC SCHOOL OF MEDICINE’S DEPARTMENTS OF FAMILY MEDICINE (DFM) AND PSYCHIATRY WILL COLLABORATE TO TRAIN PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS IN PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, AND TREATMENT OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH DISORDERS IN CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, YOUNG ADULTS, AND ADULTS. THE NEED IS WELL-ESTABLISHED, WITH A SIGNIFICANT RATE OF SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS, TRAUMA, VIOLENCE, SUICIDE, AND MENTAL HEALTH CONCERNS, ALL OF WHICH HAVE BEEN INTENSIFIED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE RATES IN NORTH CAROLINA EXCEED THE NATIONAL PREVALENCE RATES, ESPECIALLY IN THE STATE’S RURAL COUNTIES.  PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS ARE OFTEN THE FRONT LINE OF MENTAL HEALTH CARE AND PREPARING FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS FOR COMFORT AND COMPETENCE IN THIS TYPE OF CARE IS A PRIORITY.   BUILDING UPON PAST SUCCESS AND FOUNDATIONAL WORK OF CURRICULUM ENHANCEMENTS AND EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY-BASED ROTATION SITES, THIS PROJECT WILL: 1) ENHANCE DFM BEHAVIORAL HEALTH (BH) CURRICULUM FOR 42 FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENT PHYSICIANS ANNUALLY (98 OVER THE COURSE OF THE GRANT)  TO INCLUDE CARE OF CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, YOUNG ADULTS, AND ADULTS, BY CREATING A NEW ONE-MONTH MBH ROTATION, THREE BH ELECTIVE ROTATIONS, AND SPECIALIZED LONGITUDINAL DIDACTICS; 2) EXPAND INTERPROFESSIONAL TEAM BASED CARE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AT THREE SITES TO INCREASE INDEPENDENCE IN TREATING BH CONCERNS OF CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS AND ADULTS USING INTEGRATED PRIMARY CARE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH (PCBH) PRACTICE MODEL FOR THESE SAME RESIDENTS THROUGH THE ADDITION OF A CONSULTING PSYCHIATRIST AND A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONSULTANT TO THE RESIDENTS’ CARE TEAM; AND 3) INCREASE THE BH CLINICAL SKILLS OF FAMILY MEDICINE FACULTY PRECEPTORS THROUGH EVIDENCE-BASED BH TRAINING AND CME CONFERENCES.   IN ADDITION TO THE TWO ACADEMIC DEPARTMENTS INVOLVED (FAMILY MEDICINE AND PSYCHIATRY) THE PROJECT HAS INVESTED COLLABORATORS INCLUDING THE PIEDMONT HEALTH SERVICES FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTERS NETWORK (WHICH HOSTS TWO TRAINING TRACKS IN OUR RESIDENCY PROGRAM), WAKEBROOK BEHAVIORAL HEALTH FACILITY,  EL FUTURO (PROVIDES MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES FOR LATINO FAMILIES), SOUTHLIGHT HEALTHCARE, THE UNC CENTER OF EXCELLENCE FOR EATING DISORDERS, THE UNC SCHIZOPHRENIA TREATMENT AND EVALUATION PROGRAM, AND UNC’S VARIOUS SUBSTANCE USE PROGRAMS.  MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES INCLUDE THE NUMBER OF RESIDENTS COMPLETING THE REQUIRED MONTH-LONG ROTATION AND LONGITUDINAL DIDACTICS, AS WELL AS THE NUMBER WHO OPT FOR THE ELECTIVE. THE SUCCESS OF THE PSYCHIATRIC CONSULTATION SERVICE FOR CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS AND THE ROLE OF THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONSULTANT WILL BE MEASURED BY THE CONSULTATIVE ACTIVITY REQUESTED AND COMPLETED, BY BOTH RESIDENTS AND FACULTY. THE PROFESSIONAL SKILLS DEVELOPMENT OF FACULTY WILL BE MEASURED BY THE NUMBER OF FACULTY WHO COMPLETE THE TRAININGS. ALL ASPECTS OF THE PROJECT WILL BE QUALITATIVELY EVALUATED WITH SATISFACTION SURVEYS.  WE REQUEST A FUNDING PREFERENCE FOR MEETING CRITERIA IN QUALIFICATION 1, HIGH MUC PLACEMENT RATE. IN ACADEMIC YEARS 2020-2021 AND 2021-2022, 23 OF 28 GRADUATES FROM THIS DFM RESIDENCY PROGRAM (82%) PRACTICE IN SETTINGS SERVING MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. FUNDING PRIORITY IS ALSO REQUESTED AS TWO OF OUR THREE CLINICAL TRAINING SITES ARE FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTERS LOCATED IN RURAL AREAS.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - OVERVIEW: MORE PSYCHIATRIC DISORDERS ARE TREATED IN PRIMARY CARE THAN BY SPECIALISTS. THIS INCLUDES PSYCHIATRIC DISORDERS IN YOUTH. RURAL STATES SUCH AS KANSAS FACE UNPRECEDENTED SHORTAGES IN PEDIATRIC MENTAL HEALTH EXPERTS; AS A RESULT, PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS AND CLINICIANS (PCPS) MUST FILL THE GAP. THIS IS ALSO TRUE REGARDING SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS (SUD). UNFORTUNATELY, WE FACE RECORD NUMBERS OF YOUTH WITH MORBIDITIES AND MORTALITY RELATED TO MENTAL ILLNESS AND SUBSTANCE USE. A RECENT REPORT OF THE 51 STATES/TERRITORIES, RANKED KANSAS LAST IN THE OVERALL RANKING FOR MENTAL HEALTH COMPLAINTS AND ACCESS TO CARE (REINERT, 2022). FURTHER, THE NUMBER OF DRUG-RELATED PEDIATRIC DEATHS IN 2020 INCREASED, WITH OVER A 1,000% INCREASE IN DEATHS RELATED TO FENTANYL (KANSAS STATE CHILD DEATH REVIEW BOARD, 2022). PCPS AND RESIDENTS MUST BE TRAINED TO ADDRESS THESE PROBLEMS AND TO PREVENT FURTHER MORBIDITY AND MORTALITY IN YOUTH. ADDRESSING YOUTH MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ILLNESS IN PRIMARY CARE (AYM HI) ASPIRES TO TRAIN PCPS AND PEDIATRIC RESIDENTS TO SCREEN, IDENTIFY, DIAGNOSE, TREAT, AND PREVENT MENTAL ILLNESS IN YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS. WHILE DELIVERING TRAINING, AYM HI WILL ALSO IMPROVE PRIMARY CARE EDUCATION IN TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE, SUDS, AND THE EFFECTS OF VIOLENCE. KU WICHITA PEDIATRICS (KU PEDS) IS A PROVEN INNOVATIVE LEADER IN MENTAL HEALTH EDUCATION FOR PCPS. AND HAS A STRONG PARTNERSHIP WITH KU DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHIATRY AND BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES (KU PSYCHIATRY). THESE DEPARTMENTS WILL JOIN OTHER KEY PLAYERS TO ACHIEVE THE AYM HI GOAL OF ENHANCING THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PCPS.  MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES: AYM HI WILL BRING TOGETHER MENTAL HEALTH EXPERTS WITHIN AND OUTSIDE OF KU PEDS AS KEY PARTNERS TO MEET THE OVERALL PROJECT GOAL THROUGH THREE OBJECTIVES: 1) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PCPS WHO ARE TRAINED IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL FOR SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH (MBH) CONDITIONS; 2) DEVELOP AN D EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS WITH INTEGRATED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, PRIMARY CARE,  AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE CLINICAL ROTATIONS OF AT LEAST ONE MONTH IN DURATION FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS; AND 3) DEVELOP AND ENHANCE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT MBH CONTENT IN DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL TRAINING FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS INCLUDING SUICIDE PREVENTION AND TRAUMA INFORMED CARE (INCLUDING ABUSE AND GUN VIOLENCE). EACH OBJECTIVE OF AYM HI WILL BE ADDRESSED THROUGH MILESTONE ACTIVITIES. MEASURABLE OUTCOMES WILL BE TRACKED BY OUR HIGHLY EXPERIENCED EVALUATION TEAM, INCLUDING MILESTONES FOR EACH ACTIVITY WITH HIGHLIGHTED OUTCOMES INCLUDING: CURRICULUM DEVELOPED FOR A 1-MONTH MBH ROTATION; # OF RESIDENTS/FACULTY/PRECEPTORS TRAINED IN MBH AND MEDICATION FOR OPIOID USE DISORDER (MOUD); ADDITION OF A SCHOOL-BASED HEALTH ROTATION SITE WITH SITE AGREEMENT; # OF RESIDENTS/FACULTY PARTICIPATING IN MBH DIDACTICS.  METHODOLOGY: THE AYM HI LEADERSHIP TEAM WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR PROGRAM DEVELOPMENT AND ENSURING THAT OBJECTIVES ARE MET, AND DELIVERABLES ACHIEVED. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH ENHANCEMENT OF EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS AND DEVELOPMENT OF NEW PROGRAM COMPONENTS. AYM HI WILL RELY ON EXISTING EXPERTISE WITHIN THE KU PEDS AND PSYCHIATRY FACULTY AS WELL AS BUILD WORKFORCE THROUGH INTENTIONAL FACULTY AND PRECEPTOR DEVELOPMENT. NEW EXPERTS WILL BE RECRUITED AND SUPPORTED TO BUILD OR ENHANCE PROGRAMS RELATED TO MBH AND SUD.  RESIDENT BENEFICIARIES: KU PEDIATRICS IS THE ONLY PEDIATRIC RESIDENCY PROGRAM IN KANSAS. PRIMARY BENEFICIARIES OF THE AYM HI PROGRAM WILL BE PEDIATRIC RESIDENTS. ADDITIONAL RESIDENTS INCLUDING INTERNAL MEDICINE – PEDIATRIC AND FAMILY PRACTICE RESIDENTS ARE TRAINED ANNUALLY BY OUR FACULTY AND  WILL ALSO BENEFIT FROM THE PROGRAM.  FUNDING PREFERENCE/PRIORITY: AYM HI IS REQUESTING BOTH A FUNDING PRIORITY, BASED ON TRAINING RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS, AND A FUNDING PREFERENCE BASED ON A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE PLACING GRADUATES MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED COM MUNITIES.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - IN DECEMBER OF 2021 THE US SURGEON GENERAL ISSUED AN ADVISORY ON THE YOUTH MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS WHICH WAS FURTHER EXACERBATED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. IN THIS ADVISORY HE CALLED FOR HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO: RECOGNIZE THE ROLE OF PREVENTION FOR MENTAL HEALTH, BE KNOWLEDGEABLE OF TRAUMA INFORMED CARE PRINCIPLES WHEN CARING FOR YOUTH, REGULARLY SCREEN CHILDREN FOR ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES (ACES) AND OTHER MENTAL HEALTH CHALLENGES, ADDRESS THE HEALTH OF THE CAREGIVERS AND PARENTS, COLLABORATE WITH TRUSTED COMMUNITY PARTNERS AND GOVERNMENT SYSTEMS THAT SERVE CHILDREN, AND DEVELOP MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAMS TO PROVIDE SERVICES THAT ARE UNIQUELY STRUCTURED FOR CHILDREN AND THEIR SUPPORT SYSTEMS. THE UNION HOSPITAL FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY IS READY TO MEET HIS CALL. WE ARE A 21 RESIDENT, SINGLE SPONSORED PROGRAM IN A COMMUNITY MEDICAL SETTING. WE ALSO HOST MULTIPLE MEDICAL STUDENTS FROM MARION UNIVERSITY AND INDIANA UNIVERSITY SCHOOLS OF MEDICINE. WE PROPOSE TO DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE LONGITUDINAL CURRICULUM FOR OUR FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS THAT INTEGRATES TRAUMA INFORMED CARE, TREATMENT OF SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS (SUDS) WITH AN EMPHASIS ON MEDICATION ASSISTED TREATMENT (MAT), AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH TREATMENT FOR YOUTH, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS IN THE WABASH VALLEY. THE FACULTY OF THE FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY, ALONG WITH SUPPORT FROM COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS (SUCH AS SUBSTANCE USE TREATMENT, HOMELESS MITIGATION, MINORITY HEALTH COALITION) AND GOVERNMENT INSTITUTIONS (FOR EXAMPLE, SCHOOLS AND JUVENILE CENTERS), HOPE TO COMBINE FORCES TO TRAIN OUR LEARNERS TO PROVIDE A HAVEN FOR THE MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS OF THESE VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. LEARNING WILL TAKE PLACE NOT ONLY IN THE TRADITIONAL SETTING, BUT ALSO BY USING HIGH-FIDELITY SIMULATIONS, BOOTS ON THE GROUND LEARNING IN THE COMMUNITY SETTING, ENHANCED DIDACTIC LECTURES, AND STAFFING WITH AN EMPHASIS ON THESE KEY AREAS. A COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM ASSESSMENT WILL ALLOW FOR IDEN TIFICATION OF GAPS, ALONG WITH YEARLY REVIEW, AND CURRENT LEARNER AND GRADUATE FEEDBACK, WILL RESULT IN A CURRICULUM THAT REMAINS UP TO DATE AND ALLOWS US TO CREATE PHYSICIANS THAT ARE ABLE TO SERVE THE NEEDS OF THE YOUTH OF THEIR COMMUNITIES. WE ARE APPLYING FOR SPECIAL FUNDING PREFERENCE BECAUSE MOST OF OUR GRADUATES WORK IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. THE COUNTY THAT HOUSES OUR RESIDENCY IS THE WORST IN THE STATE OF INDIANA FOR CHILD POVERTY AND FOOD INSECURITY. WE ARE NOT GIVING UP ON OUR COMMUNITY BUT ARE COMMITTED TO BECOMING PART OF THE SOLUTION.

SPECIFIC MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES AND ACCOMPLISHMENTS: GOAL 1: INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS WHO ARE TRAINED IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS. PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - THE BEHAVIORAL MEDICINE RESIDENCY INNOVATIONS, TRAININGS, AND ENHANCEMENTS (BRITE) PROGRAM IS AN INTERDISCIPLINARY EFFORT AT JOHN PETER SMITH HEALTH NETWORK (JPS) AND COMMUNITY PARTNERS WITHIN TARRANT COUNTY (TC) AIMED AT ADDRESSING AND MEETING THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH NEEDS OF ALL TC CITIZENS, AS WELL AS BROADER POPULATIONS (E.G., RURAL TEXANS). BRITE WILL FOCUS ON TRANSFORMING CLINICAL TRAINING ENVIRONMENTS FOR FAMILY MEDICINE (FM) RESIDENTS IN INTEGRATED BEHAVIORAL MEDICINE AND PRIMARY CARE DELIVERY SYSTEMS TO ENSURE TRAINEES ARE WELL PREPARED TO PRACTICE IN AND TAKE LEADERSHIP ROLES THAT RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH IN PRIMARY CARE. THE INVESTMENT AND TRAINING BY BRITE WILL LEAVE A SUSTAINABLE FOOTPRINT THAT CREATES AND DELIVERS QUALITY EDUCATIONAL TRAINING TO MEET THE COMPLEX DEMANDS OF RURAL PRIMARY CARE.   THE BRITE PROGRAM WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED VIA A CROSS DEPARTMENTAL EFFORT AT JPS AND WILL INCLUDE FACULTY FROM BOTH THE PSYCHIATRY AND FAMILY MEDICINE DEPARTMENTS.  OVER THE 5 YEAR GRANT PERIOD, BRITE FACULTY WILL WORK TO IMPROVE FAMILY MEDICINE DIDACTICS OFFERED TO ALL RESIDENTS, IMPROVE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ELECTIVES FOR FAMILY MEDICINE (ALONGSIDE COMMUNITY PARTNERS – TARRANT COUNTY WOMEN’S CENTER, RESOURCE RECOVERY COUNCIL, AND MY HEALTH MY RESOURCES TARRANT COUNTY), IMPROVE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PRECEPTING IN THE FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAM, OFFER A SPECIALTY CERTIFICATE FOR BEHAVIORAL MEDICINE TRAINING, AS WELL AS A FULL BEHAVIORAL MEDICINE TRACK TO INCLUDE A MASTER’S DEGREE IN MARRIAGE AND FAMILY THERAPY.  THIS DEGREE WILL BE OFFERED WITH BRITE COMMUNITY PARTNER, TEXAS WESLEYAN UNIVERSITY.  BRITE STAFF PLANS TO EXPAND CURRENT BEHAVIORAL HEALTH EDUCATION THROUGH THESE PARTNERSHIPS THAT WILL EXPAND AND ENHANCE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH TRAINING, ESPECIALLY IN THE AREAS OF SUICIDE PREVENTION AND GUN VIOLENCE.  BRITE WILL IMPACT THE JPS FM RESIDENCY BY PREPARING GRADUATES FOR ADVANCED BEHAVIORAL MEDICINE PRACTICE IN CLINI CAL CARE, INCLUDING PSYCHOTHERAPEUTIC PRACTICE AND PSYCHIATRIC PRESCRIBING.  ADDITIONALLY, THE BRITE PROGRAM WILL POSITIVELY IMPACT THE JPS PSYCHIATRY RESIDENCY AS THEY WILL ALSO HAVE INCREASED OPPORTUNITIES TO TRAIN ALONGSIDE FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS AND GAIN A BETTER UNDERSTANDING OF THE NEEDS OF RURAL PRIMARY HEALTH CARE.  THE BRITE PROGRAM WILL GRADUATE 120 RESIDENTS DURING THE 5-YEAR PERIOD OF WHICH 18 CERTIFICATES WILL BE ISSUED AND 7 RESIDENTS FROM THE PGY4 PROGRAM.  WITH JPS FM RESIDENCY PROGRAM BEING THE LARGEST FAMILY MEDICINE PROGRAM IN THE COUNTRY AND TRAINING MORE RESIDENTS TO WORK IN RURAL AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES THAN ANY OTHER RESIDENCY IN THE NATION, THE BRITE PROGRAM IS REQUESTING FUNDING PRIORITY AS JPS HAD A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE IN PLACING RESIDENTS IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED PRACTICE SETTINGS.  JPS HAD A PLACEMENT RATE OF 59% INCREASE OF ITS GRADUATES WORKING IN AN MUC (DEFINED AS HPSA OR MUA) FROM ACADEMIC YEAR 2020-21 TO 2021-22.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - 1.	OVERVIEW: THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROPOSAL IS TO TRAIN UNIVERSITY AT BUFFALO FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS FOR THE PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT, YOUNG ADULT, AND OTHER POPULATIONS WHO ARE AT-RISK OR HAVE EXPERIENCED ABUSE, TRAUMA, OR MENTAL HEALTH AND/OR SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS, INCLUDING THOSE RELATED TO THE EFFECTS OF GUN VIOLENCE.   2.	OBJECTIVES: THE MAJOR GOALS FOR THIS PROJECT ARE AS FOLLOWS: (1) INCREASING THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS TRAINED ON SCREENING, AND BRIEF INTERVENTION TO IMPROVE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH; (2) INCREASING THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS TRAINED ON REFERRAL TO TREATMENT IN PARTNERSHIPS FOR INTEGRATING PRIMARY CARE WITH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH; AND (3) EVALUATING THE PROGRAM USING RAPID CYCLE QUALITY IMPROVEMENT (RCQI) STRATEGIES TO CONTINUOUSLY MONITOR LEARNING INPUT AND RESIDENTS’ SATISFACTION WITH THE LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES AND THEIR CLINICAL COMPETENCE; AND DISSEMINATING PROGRAM RESULTS. SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: (1.1) ENHANCING THE CURRICULUM IN BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SBIRT (SCREENING, BRIEF INTERVENTION, AND REFERRAL TO TREATMENT); AND (1.2) DIDACTIC TRAINING IN BEHAVIORAL HEALTH; (2.1) BUILDING/ENHANCING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS FOR CARE INTEGRATION; (2.2) ESTABLISHING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CLINICAL ROTATIONS; (2.3) IMPLEMENTING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SPECIAL CURRICULAR TOPICS; AND (2.4) HAVING RESIDENTS COMPLETE SCHOLARLY QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS; AND  (3.1) INCREASING THE NUMBER OF RESIDENTS TRAINED IN SBI; (3.2) TRAINING PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS IN RT; (3.3) IMPROVED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH OUTCOMES (THROUGH IMPROVEMENT WITHIN TEACHING STRATEGIES); AND (3.4) HRSA REPORTING AND DISSEMINATION.  3.	HOW THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED: THE PROJECT DIRECTOR, THE STEERING COMMITTEE, AND OUR PROJECT TEAM WILL LEVERAGE EXISTING EXPERTISE IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, ESPECIALLY FOR CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS , AND YOUNG ADULTS, AND IN RURAL, UNDERSERVED, AND VULNERABLE POPULATIONS FROM THE UNIVERSITY AND OUR CLINICAL PARTNERS TO CREATE AN ENHANCED, COHESIVE, AND DIDACTIC TRAINING CURRICULUM AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING EXPERIENCE FOR RESIDENTS. TEAM MEMBERS WILL UTILIZE EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICE AND THEIR EXPERTISE IN PROGRAM EVALUATION, INTER-PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION, RURAL HEALTH, HEALTH DISPARITY, TELEHEALTH, BEHAVIORAL INTERVENTIONS IN PRIMARY CARE, AND PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND STATISTICAL ANALYSIS. WE WILL COLLABORATE WITH OUR COMMUNITY-BASED RESIDENCY PARTNERS, THE UNIVERSAL PRIMARY CARE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER, JERICHO ROAD COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER, ERIE COUNTY MEDICAL CENTER (ECMC) FAMILY HEALTH CENTER, AND UBMD FAMILY MEDICINE OF AMHERST TO DEVELOP ROTATIONS FOR A MINIMUM OF ONE MONTH FOCUSING PRIMARILY ON MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH.  4.	MEDICAL RESIDENCY SPECIALTIES THAT ARE BENEFICIARIES OF THE PROJECT: THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF WELL-TRAINED FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS BY ENHANCING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH EDUCATION FOR UNIVERSITY AT BUFFALO FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS, LEADING TO A MORE EFFECTIVE INTEGRATION OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CAPACITY IN PRIMARY CARE. IN TOTAL, 48 RESIDENTS PER YEAR* WILL BENEFIT FROM THIS PROGRAM EACH YEAR OVER THE 5-YEAR GRANT CYCLE (*32 IN THE 9-MONTH “YEAR 1”).  5.  FUNDING PREFERENCE/PRIORITY: WE ARE REQUESTING BOTH FUNDING PRIORITY AND FUNDING PREFERENCE FOR THIS PROPOSAL. THE UB DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY MEDICINE IS REQUESTING FUNDING PREFERENCE QUALIFICATION 1: HIGH MUC PLACEMENT RATE AS IT HAS DEMONSTRATED THE ABILITY TO SUCCESSFULLY PLACE GRADUATES (53.33%) INTO PRACTICE SETTINGS THAT HAVE THE PRINCIPAL FOCUS OF SERVING MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES (MUC). 	THIS PROJECT IS REQUESTING FUNDING PRIORITY (5 POINTS) BECAUSE THE APPLICATION HAS TRAINED, AND WILL CONTINUE TO TRAIN, FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS IN A DESIGNATED HRSA RURAL HEALTH GRANT ELIGIBLE AREA SERVED BY UNIVERSAL PRIMARY CARE COMMUNITY HEALTH CENTER.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - SAN FRANCISCO GENERAL HOSPITAL AND TRAUMA CENTER’S PRIMARY CARE TRACK OF THE UCSF INTERNAL MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAM PROPOSES TO ENHANCE TRAINING FOR RESIDENTS INTEGRATING SKILLS, TREATMENT ADVOCACY AND RESILIENCE FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH (TRI-STAR-MBH). OUR MULTIDISCIPLINARY FACULTY OFFER EXPERTISE RELEVANT TO THE PREVENTION AND MANAGEMENT OF MENTAL HEALTH CONDITIONS IN A LARGE NETWORK OF SAFETY NET CLINICS, PARTNERING WITH COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, TO SERVE A DIVERSE, MEDICALLY AND SOCIALLY COMPLEX POPULATION, WITH A FOCUS ON THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, AND TREATMENT OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS AFFECTING POPULATIONS EXPERIENCING TRAUMA, GUN VIOLENCE, SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS AND CHRONIC MENTAL ILLNESS.  OUR OUTSTANDING FACULTY EDUCATORS INCLUDE NATIONAL EXPERTS IN MEDICAL EDUCATION, CURRICULAR DEVELOPMENT, PSYCHIATRY, PSYCHOLOGY, ADDICTION AND BEHAVIORAL MEDICINE, ADOLESCENT MENTAL HEALTH, MATERNAL HEALTH, AND BEHAVIORAL INTEGRATION IN PRIMARY CARE.  PROJECT OBJECTIVES:  1. ENHANCE THE QUALITY OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH TRAINING ANNUALLY PROVIDED TO 24 PRIMARY CARE TRAINEES, AS MEASURED BY SURVEYS, STRUCTURED INTERVIEWS, AND COMPARISONS TO TRAINEES RECEIVING STANDARD TRAINING.  2. FACILITATE AT LEAST 2 HOURS OF PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE BY 30 PRIMARY CARE CLINICAL FACULTY AND PRECEPTORS AND 60 CLINICAL STAFF MEMBERS.  3. SUPPORT 16 PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS IN COMPLETING AT LEAST 4 WEEKS OF CLINICAL IMMERSION TRAINING ON A ROTATION IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, IN THE 2ND AND 3RD YEARS OF THEIR TRAINING, TO INCREASE SKILLS IN PROVIDING CULTURALLY SENSITIVE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE TO DIVERSE POPULATIONS, INCLUDING THOSE WITH LIMITED ENGLISH PROFICIENCY.  4. ENGAGE A COMMUNITY ADVISORY BOARD IN QUARTERLY MEETINGS TO REFINE PRIMARY CARE TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH.  5. DELIVER MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH DIDACTIC TRAINING TO 100 PRIMARY CARE TRAINEES ACROSS MULTIPLE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA HEALTH CAMPUSES.  6. ENSURE TRAINING MATERIALS ARE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY RELEVANT TO DIVERSE PRIMARY CARE POPULATIONS,  OUR THREE-YEAR CURRICULUM WILL INCLUDE MULTIPLE CLINICAL ELECTIVE OPPORTUNITIES AND CORE TRAINING ON TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE, VIOLENCE PREVENTION, SUICIDE PREVENTION, HEALTHCARE FOR INCARCERATED PEOPLE, CARE OF PEOPLE EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS, ADOLESCENT MENTAL HEALTH, PERINATAL MENTAL HEALTH, TRANS HEALTH, AND EVIDENCE-BASED PRIMARY CARE MANAGEMENT OF COMMON MENTAL HEALTH CONDITIONS INCLUDING DEPRESSION, ANXIETY, INSOMNIA, PTSD AND ADHD.  PROJECT DIRECTOR, LISA OCHOA-FRONGIA, MD, HAS ASSEMBLED AN OUTSTANDING TEAM WITH COMPLEMENTARY SKILLS. THIS PROJECT WILL BENEFIT FROM QUARTERLY MEETINGS WITH A COMMUNITY ADVISORY BOARD, COMPRISED OF PATIENTS, COMMUNITY MEMBERS, CLINIC ADMINISTRATORS AND EDUCATIONAL LEADERS. WE WILL RIGOROUSLY EVALUATE THE IMPACT OF THIS TRAINING ENHANCEMENT USING BOTH QUALITATIVE AND QUANTITATIVE APPROACHES TO MEASURE CHANGES IN CLINICAL KNOWLEDGE, ATTITUDES, AND PRACTICE PATTERNS, AMONG FACULTY, TRAINEES AND GRADUATES. OVER THE FIVE-YEAR PROJECT PERIOD, WE WILL CONTINUOUSLY IMPROVE THE TRAINING EXPERIENCE, AND ENGAGE OTHER COMMUNITY RESOURCES WITH THE GOAL OF ACHIEVING INDEPENDENT FUNDING CAPABLE OF SUSTAINING THIS TRAINING PROGRAM WELL BEYOND THE INITIAL YEARS OF PROPOSED SUPPORT.   THE MAIN BENEFICIARIES OF THIS TRAINING ENHANCEMENT WILL BE 24 GENERAL INTERNAL MEDICINE RESIDENTS COMMITTED TO PRIMARY CARE CAREERS IN URBAN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. WE WILL EXPAND OUR REACH BY SHARING DIDACTICS WITH OTHER UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA PRIMARY CARE TRAINING PROGRAMS, ALLOWING US TO ANNUALLY ENHANCE THE TRAINING OF OVER 100 PRIMARY CARE TRAINEES.  FUNDING PREFERENCE REQUESTED: QUALIFICATION 1, REFLECTING HIGH MUC PLACEMENT RATES (56.3%) FOR GRADUATES OF OUR TRAINING PROGRAM IN ACADEMIC YEARS 2020-2021 AND 2021-2022.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - THE ALASKA FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAM (AKFMR) OF PROVIDENCE HEALTH & SERVICES – WASHINGTON (PROVIDENCE) REQUESTS A PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT – RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH GRANT TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF FAMILY MEDICINE PHYSICIANS TRAINED TO PROVIDE CULTURALLY COMPETENT, TRAUMA-INFORMED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND SUBSTANCE USE SERVICES FOR ALASKA'S UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS IN INTERDISCIPLINARY TREATMENT SETTINGS. HRSA FUNDING WILL ALLOW AKFMR TO TRAIN 84 RESIDENTS THROUGHOUT THE FIVE-YEAR FUNDING PERIOD. BY THE END OF THE GRANT, 36 RESIDENTS WILL HAVE COMPLETED THE ENTIRE 3-YEAR LONGITUDINAL CURRICULUM. GRANT FUNDING WILL ENHANCE THE CURRENT INTERDISCIPLINARY PRIMARY CARE TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AS WELL AS OPIOID USE DISORDER (OUD), SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS (SUD), AND CO-OCCURRING MENTAL HEALTH AND SUD / OUD DISORDERS. ADDITIONAL FOCUS AND TRAINING AREAS WILL INCLUDE ADOLESCENT AND PERINATAL MENTAL HEALTH.    ALASKA FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY IS THE ONLY FULL-TIME MEDICAL RESIDENCY PROGRAM IN ALASKA. AKFMR WAS DEVELOPED TO TRAIN FAMILY MEDICINE PHYSICIANS TO PRACTICE IN ANY PART OF ALASKA, INCLUDING REMOTE AND ISOLATED ALASKAN COMMUNITIES. AKFMR PROVIDES RIGOROUS TRAINING TO HELP PREPARE RESIDENTS TO PRACTICE IN ANY CHALLENGING, PARTICULARLY RURAL SETTINGS. IN ADDITION, RESIDENTS RECEIVE EXTRA TRAINING IN RURAL LOCATIONS, EMERGENCY MEDICINE, ORTHOPEDICS, OBSTETRICS, PEDIATRICS, NEONATAL INTENSIVE CARE, AND TRANS-CULTURAL MEDICINE TO PREPARE THEM FOR THE UNIQUE CHALLENGES OF BUSH PRACTICE.  THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ALLOW AKFMR TO ENHANCE AND EXPAND THE TRAINING OF PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL TO SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS FOR THE PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT, YOUNG ADULT, AND PERINATAL POPULATIONS WHO ARE AT-RISK OR HAVE EXPERIENCED ABUSE, TRAUMA, OR MENTAL HEALTH AND/OR SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS, INCLUDING THOSE RELATED TO THE EFFECTS OF GUN VIOLENCE. THE PROJECT WILL INTEGRATE PSYCHIATRIC, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, AND ADDICTION MEDICINE CLINICAL SUPERVISION INTO PRE-EXISTING RESIDENT ROTATIONS; MANY SUCH ROTATIONS FOCUS ON PROVIDING CARE TO UNDERSERVED PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT, YOUNG ADULT, PERINATAL, AND OTHER VULNERABLE POPULATIONS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO CREATE NEW ROTATIONS FOR THE RESIDENTS THAT INTEGRATE A PSYCHIATRIC AND ADDICTION MEDICINE FOCUS WITHIN FAMILY MEDICINE PRACTICES AT PARTNER SITES. REQUIRED AND SELECTIVE ROTATIONS WILL OFFER UNIQUE OPPORTUNITIES TO TRAINEES, PROVIDE VALUABLE SERVICES IN DESPERATELY NEEDED SERVICE LINES, AND STRENGTHEN PROVIDER PIPELINES THROUGHOUT ALASKA.     AKFMR REQUESTS A FUNDING PRIORITY BASED ON THE TRAINING OF RESIDENTS IN 2021-2022 IN RURAL AREAS, INCLUDING TRIBES AND TRIBAL ORGANIZATIONS IN SUCH AREAS. AKFMR REQUESTS A FUNDING PREFERENCE BASED ON ITS HIGH MUC PLACEMENT RATE OF 92% IN 2021 AND 2022.

HIGH MUC PLACEMENT RATE   THE MONTANA FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY (MFMR) HAS BEEN PREPARING COMMUNITY HEALTH-ORIENTED PRIMARY CARE DOCTORS IN FULL SCOPE FAMILY MEDICINE SINCE 1995.    WITH ROOTS AS A STATEWIDE EFFORT TO IMPROVE THE HEALTH OF RURAL AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, MFMR WAS FORMED AS A CONSORTIUM MODEL WITH ST VINCENT HEALTHCARE, BILLINGS CLINIC AND RIVERSTONE HEALTH (RSH).   MFMR REMAINED THE ONLY GRADUATE MEDICAL EDUCATION PROGRAM IN THE STATE UNTIL 2013.   MONTANA RANKS 48TH OF THE FIFTY STATES IN THE RATIO OF ACTIVE RESIDENTS PER CAPITA, AND 15 MONTANA COUNTIES EXIST WITHOUT A SINGLE PRACTICING PHYSICIAN.  DESPITE THE CHALLENGE, MFMR HAS PLAYED A PIVOTAL ROLE IN EDUCATING PHYSICIANS WHO ARE INTERESTED IN RURAL AND FRONTIER MEDICINE WITH 95 GRADUATES REMAINING IN MONTANA, MOSTLY IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.     SINCE ITS INCEPTION, MFMR HAS PARTNERED WITH RSH WHICH OPERATES A PUBLIC MODEL FEDERALLY-QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER, AND OTHER HEALTH-RELATED SERVICES.  THIS COLLABORATION HAS FOSTERED DEVELOPMENT OF A ROBUST EDUCATIONAL HEALTH CENTER THAT SERVES AS A MODEL FOR BOTH PATIENT CARE AND WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT.   RIVERSTONE HEALTH CLINIC (RSHC), THE FEDERALLY QUALIFIED HEALTH CENTER, INCLUDES A LARGE “MAIN CAMPUS” WHERE MFMR IS BASED, TWO SCHOOL-BASED CLINICS, TWO HEALTHCARE FOR THE HOMELESS CLINICS, AS WELL AS THREE RURAL CLINICS.  SERVICES ARE PROVIDED AT BOTH LOCAL HOSPITALS AND IN SKILLED NURSING FACILITIE S AS WELL.   MFMR WAS FULLY INTEGRATED INTO RSH IN 2006, WITH EMPLOYMENT OF RESIDENTS AND FACULTY.   THE CONSORTIUM STRUCTURE AND ASSOCIATED 501(C)3 CORPORATION OF MFMR REMAIN IN PLACE, WITH CRITICAL SUPPORT FROM BOTH LOCAL HOSPITALS IN THE TEACHING AND DEVELOPMENT OF RESIDENTS.  IN 2011, MFMR AND RSHC BECAME ONE OF THE ORIGINAL ELEVEN HRSA TEACHING HEALTH CENTER GRANTEES.   MFMR IS EXPANDING FROM AN 8-8-8 RESIDENCY TO A 10-10-10 PROGRAM WITH 10 GRADUATES IN EACH YEAR, BEGINNING IN JULY 2023.      THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE THE CURRICULUM FOR FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS RELATED TO MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH FOR PEDIATRIC AND YOUNG ADULT PATIENTS.  FAMILY MEDICINE PHYSICIANS, AND MFMR GRADUATES IN PARTICULAR, OFTEN PRACTICE IN RURAL AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WITHOUT ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH SPECIALISTS.  BY EFFECTIVELY PREPARING FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS, MFMR CAN EFFECTIVELY MITIGATE THE OVERWHELMING NEED FOR SUCH SERVICES THROUGHOUT MONTANA.  JULIE KELSO, MD, IS A BOARD-CERTIFIED PSYCHIATRIST WHO WILL SERVE AS THE PROJECT DIRECTOR.  ADDITIONAL PROJECT TEAM MEMBERS INCLUDE FACULTY LEADERSHIP, CLINICIANS AND PRECEPTORS AS WELL AS OPERATIONAL LEADERSHIP TO ENSURE ACHIEVEMENT OF PROJECT OBJECTIVES.  THE AUGMENTED CURRICULUM WILL INCLUDE ROTATIONS AT RURAL AND HIGH NEED LOCATIONS TO ENSURE THE GREATEST IMPACT ON BOTH LEARNING AND SERVICE TO THE COMMUNITY.   MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: -	RESIDENT COMPLETION OF A REQUIRED ONE MONTH LONGITUDINAL ROTATION IN MENTAL & BEHAVIORAL HEALTH IN PEDIATRIC AND YOUNG ADULT PATIENTS INCLUDING PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT AND REFERRAL.   -	DEVELOPMENT OF ENHANCED PARTNERSHIPS TO AUGMENT RESIDENT CLINICAL EXPERIENCE IN M&BH. -	AUGMENT TRAINING IN MEDICATION FOR OPIOID USE DISORDER. -	ENHANCE FACULTY DEVELOPMENT CURRICULUM TO SUPPORT EFFECTIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT AS IT RELATES TO M&BH. -	COLLECT POST-GRADUATION DATA USING NPI NUMBERS TO TRACK RESIDENTS OVER TIME.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - NOW IS THE TIME, IN THE MIDST OF A GLOBAL MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS, WITH INCREASED PREVALENCE OF DISORDERS, PREVAILING BARRIERS TO CARE, AND WIDENING INEQUITIES AND DISPARITIES, TO ORGANIZE AS HEALTHCARE INSTITUTIONS AND COMMUNITIES TO PROVIDE FOR THE MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS OF OUR CHILDREN. THOUGH THIS HAS BEEN A LONG-STANDING CHALLENGE FOR PEDIATRIC PRIMARY CARE PROVIDERS GIVEN A MULTITUDE OF BARRIERS INCLUDING LACK OF TIME, EXPERIENCE AND REFERRAL RESOURCES, WE CAN NO LONGER AVOID PRIORITIZING CHILD MENTAL HEALTH IN THIS GREAT TIME OF NEED.  THE NEW YORK PRESBYTERIAN COLUMBIA UNIVERSITY MEDICAL CENTER (NYP-CUIMC), IS ONE OF NEW YORK’S LARGEST ACADEMIC MEDICAL CENTERS, SERVING A DIVERSE AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY. NYP-CUIMC HAS BEGUN TO ORGANIZE ITS RESOURCES AND PROVIDE TRAINING TO ITS PEDIATRIC RESIDENT TRAINEES TO ELEVATE MENTAL HEALTH AND EQUITABLE CARE, BUT MORE NEEDS TO BE DONE. WITH THIS PROPOSED PROJECT, WE AIM TO UTILIZE EXISTING RESOURCES IN OUR DIVISIONS OF CHILD & ADOLESCENT HEALTH AND CHILD & ADOLESCENT PSYCHIATRY, AND OUR LONGSTANDING HISTORY OF COMMUNITY AND POPULATION HEALTH COLLABORATION, TO CREATE A COMPREHENSIVE MENTAL HEALTH TRAINING PROGRAM FOR OUR PEDIATRIC RESIDENT TRAINEES. THE PROGRAM WILL BE ROOTED IN OUR INSTITUTION’S THREE TENETS OF 1) TIERED APPROACHES TO CARE INCLUDING PROMOTION OF HEALTH, AND PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, TREATMENT AND REFERRAL FOR HEALTH RISKS; 2) A BIO-PSYCHO-SOCIAL MODEL ADDRESSING THE MULTITUDE OF CONTEXTUAL FACTORS THAT AFFECT WHOLE HEALTH; AND 3) ASSURING EQUITY AND CULTURAL AND LINGUISTIC COMPETENCE IN THE CARE PROVIDED.  OUR OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: 1. FORMAL EVIDENCE-BASED MENTAL HEALTH TRAINING FOLLOWED BY EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING IN PRIMARY CARE (CONTINUITY CLINIC) WITH: A. SCREENING AND A TIERED APPROACH TO “RESPONSE TO SCREENING” INCLUDING THE USE OF BRIEF INTERVENTIONS AND A TOOLKIT OF RESOURCES AND REFERRALS B. SUPPORT FROM INTEGRATED MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS IN THE PRIMARY CARE SETTING SUCH A S CO-PRECEPTING WITH CO-LOCATED MENTAL HEALTH STAFF, AND USING AN INTEGRATED MENTAL HEALTH IPAD-ON-WHEELS METHOD FOR REAL-TIME CONSULTATION C. RESIDENT ENGAGEMENT IN QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS TO IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS GAPS IN MENTAL HEALTHCARE 2. ENGAGING IN SERVICE LEARNING WITH ACADEMIC-COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP ROTATIONS IN EARLY CHILDHOOD (PARENT-CHILD GROUPS), SCHOOL-BASED MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS AND ADOLESCENT MENTAL HEALTH INCLUDING OUR UPTOWN ADOLESCENT HUB.  3. STRENGTHENING OR DEVELOPING EXPERIENTIAL AND SERVICE-LEARNING OPPORTUNITIES TO ADDRESS SUICIDE, TRAUMA & TRAUMA INFORMED CARE, GUN VIOLENCE AND SUBSTANCE USE IN OUR PEDIATRIC POPULATIONS ALONGSIDE COMMUNITY PARTNER AGENCIES.   WITH THIS COMPREHENSIVE PROGRAM WE HOPE TO ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF OUR PEDIATRIC RESIDENTS AND PEDIATRIC PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS TO RECOGNIZE OUR POPULATION’S MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS, AND RESPOND TO THOSE NEEDS EFFECTIVELY AND EQUITABLY. WE WILL MEASURE OUR EFFECTIVENESS AT ACHIEVING THESE GOALS WITH A MULTI-METHOD EVALUATION INCLUDING THE COLLECTION OF PROCESS MEASURES SUCH AS ENGAGEMENT AND ADOPTION OF RESOURCES AND TOOLS, A CONTROLLED PRE AND POST EVALUATION OF RESIDENT MENTAL HEALTH LITERACY, AND A QUALITATIVE EVALUATION OF RESIDENT EXPERIENCES.  LESSONS LEARNED FROM THIS PROGRAM AND EVALUATION WILL INFORM THE SUSTAINABILITY OF A MENTAL HEALTH TRAINING PROGRAM THAT WILL ASSURE WE ARE BETTER POSITIONED TO ALWAYS RISE TO THE CHALLENGE OF ADDRESSING MENTAL HEALTH AMIDST ANY PANDEMIC OR CRISIS, AND PROTECT AND PROVIDE FOR OUR CHILDREN. FUNDING PRIORITY IS REQUESTED FOR THIS PROPOSAL BASED ON QUALIFICATION #2, WHICH INCLUDES A SIGNIFICANT INCREASE OF > 25% IN RESIDENT GRADUATE PLACEMENT IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS FROM THE YEARS 2019-2020 TO 2020-2021.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - OVERVIEW: THE UNITED STATES AND THE STATE OF TENNESSEE ARE EXPERIENCING A MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISIS.  THE PREVALENCE OF MENTAL ILLNESSES, SUCH AS MOOD AND ANXIETY DISORDERS, AND COGNITIVE, DEVELOPMENTAL, AND PSYCHOTIC DISORDERS IS EXTREMELY HIGH. IN 2020, SUICIDE WAS THE SECOND LEADING CAUSE OF DEATH AMONG YOUTH AND YOUNG ADULTS AGES 10-14 IN THE UNITED STATES. THE IMPACT OF THIS CRISIS IS FELT AND IS REFLECTED IN THE SUICIDE RATE AT 10% FOR CHILDREN IN TENNESSEE.  A SHORTAGE OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS ADDS TO THIS CRISIS BY REDUCING ACCESSIBILITY, AVAILABILITY, AND ACCEPTABILITY OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIOR HEALTH SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS. TO ADDRESS THIS SHORTAGE, THIS APPLICATION PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT AN INTEGRATED PEDIATRIC FOCUSED MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL TRAINING CENTER WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY AND COMMUNITY MEDICINE IN COLLABORATION WITH CHEROKEE HEALTH SYSTEMS AND TENNESSEE AREA HEALTH EDUCATION CENTER (TN AHEC). THE CENTER WILL USE A DIFFERENTIATED SERVICE DELIVERY (DSD) MODEL THAT WILL INCLUDE TRAINING AND WRAPAROUND SERVICES:  IMPLEMENTING A PERSON CENTERED APPROACH TO MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICE DELIVERY. OBJECTIVES:  1) TRAIN 18 FAMILY AND COMMUNITY RESIDENTS IN PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS EACH YEAR OF THE PROPOSAL FOR A TOTAL OF 90; 2) IDENTIFY, EXPAND, AND RECRUIT OF 30 UNDERSERVED AND RURAL HEALTH SITES IN TENNESSEE. 3)  DESIGN AND IMPLEMENT THE ONE-MONTH CLINICAL ROTATION WITH DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL TRAINING FOR FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS WITH ADDITIONAL EXPOSURE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ON EXISTING ROTATIONS (PSYCHIATRY, OBSTETRICS AND GYNECOLOGY, AND PEDIATRICS). METHODOLOGY: THE DEPARTMENT OF PEDIATRICS, THE DEPARTMENTS OF FAMILY AND COMMUNITY MEDICINE, AND THE DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHIATRY WILL ESTABLISH AND OPERATE A TRAINING SITE WITH A COMMUNITY WALK-IN CENTER FOR YOUTH AND FAMILIES EXPERIENCING  MENTAL AND BEHAVIOR HEALTH ISSUES IN COLLABORATION WITH CHEROKEE HEALTH SYSTEMS AND TN AHEC. THE CENTER WILL OFFER TRAINING FOR FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS WHO WILL SEE PERSONS AND FAMILIES EXPERIENCING MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL ISSUES INCLUDING ADHD, AUTISM, AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE. PEDIATRIC AND FACULTY FROM PSYCHIATRY WILL BE ASSIGNED TO THIS CENTER TO MODEL SKILLS INCLUDING HOW TO PRESCRIBE MEDICATIONS FOR OPIOID USE DISORDERS (MOUD) AND HOW TO SCREEN, DIAGNOSE, AND TREAT CHILDREN WITH MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ISSUE.  IN YEARS 1-5, THE CENTER WILL BE STAFFED BY CERTIFIED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROVIDERS (SOCIAL WORKERS, CHILD PSYCHIATRISTS, AND/OR COUNSELORS).  FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS WILL BE PAIRED WITH RESIDENTS FROM PSYCHIATRY FOR PEER LEARNING AND TRAINING.  IN THE HUB, CHILDREN AND YOUTH WILL COME TO A SAFE SPACE TO RECEIVE AN ASSESSMENT WITHOUT HAVING TO GO TO AN EMERGENCY ROOM OR PSYCHIATRIC HOSPITAL. ADDITIONALLY, THE MEDICAL RESIDENCY SPECIALTIES THAT WILL BENEFIT MOST WILL BE FAMILY MEDICINE AND PEDIATRICS. THE DEPARTMENTS OF PEDIATRICS WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY AND COMMUNITY MEDICINE TO OFFER DIDACTICS AND CLINICAL SERVICES TO TRAIN ALL OF ITS 18 RESIDENTS IN YEARS 1-5.  A MONTH (4 WEEKS) MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ROTATION WITH CHEROKEE HEALTH SYSTEMS WILL BE IMPLEMENTED. JOINT WEBINARS WILL BE OFFERED TO ADD ADDITIONAL DIDACTICS IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL WEBINAR SERIES ON A MONTHLY BASIS.  TENNESSEE PRIMARY CARE ASSOCIATION WILL ASSIST IN IDENTIFYING 10 NEW RURAL MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL SITES ACROSS THE STATE OF TENNESSEE.  EVALUATION:   RESIDENTS WILL BE EVALUATED BY THE PEDIATRIC FACULTY PRECEPTOR, THE PEDIATRIC MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PRECEPTOR, AND THE FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY DIRECTOR TO REINFORCE SKILLS AND LEARNING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PRACTICE.  FUNDING PRIORITY AND FUNDING PREFERENCE:  A FUNDING PRIORITY AND FUNDING PREFERENCE HAVE BEEN REQUESTED BASED ON HIGH-RATE AND PLACEMENT OF RESIDENTS IN RURAL HEALTH SITE S.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - RECOGNIZING THAT RESIDENCY IS THE CRITICAL LEARNING PERIOD AS NORMATIVE PRACTICES OF CARE ARE SET, WACO FAMILY MEDICINE’S PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT PROGRAM WILL CULTIVATE AND EXPAND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH COMPETENCIES DURING RESIDENCY, INCREASING THE QUALITY OF THESE SERVICES PROVIDED BY FAMILY MEDICINE PHYSICIANS.  OUR RESIDENCY TRAINING OCCURS WITHIN A PRIMARY CARE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH INNOVATION HUB THAT PRODUCES AND MAINTAINS NATIONALLY RECOGNIZED DECISION SUPPORT TOOLS; OFFERS APPRENTICESHIP-STYLE TRAINING FOR BEHAVIORAL HEALTH IN A DEDICATED ROTATION WITH A CLINICAL PSYCHOLOGIST IN CO-VISITS ALONG WITH REAL-TIME SUPERVISION FROM FAMILY MEDICINE FACULTY; FEATURES PRIMARY CARE ADDICTION MEDICINE EXPERIENCE; AND PROVIDES CONTINUITY TRAINING WITH INTEGRATED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROVIDERS.    THIS PROGRAM INCLUDES MAINTAINING AND AUGMENTING HUMAN BEHAVIORAL AND MENTAL HEALTH AND OUTPATIENT PEDIATRIC EXPERIENCES THROUGH SCHEDULED CLINICAL ROTATIONS AT WACO FAMILY MEDICINE (WFM) CLINICS PREDOMINANTLY SERVING UNDER-SERVED CHILDREN AND ADOLESCENTS.  IN ADDITION TO THESE EXPERIENCES, WFM WILL ADD NEW EXTERNAL CLINIC SITES THROUGH EXPANDED PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH/PRIMARY CARE ORGANIZATIONS.  RESIDENTS WILL INTERFACE WITH SPECIALTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE THROUGH CLINICAL TRAINING WITH A CHILD AND ADOLESCENT PSYCHIATRY AS WELL AS A CRISIS INTERVENTION.  BUILDING ON OUR CURRENT FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY FOUNDATION, THIS PROJECT WILL EXPAND THE CURRENT MEDICATION FOR OPIOID USE DISORDER (MOUD) TO INCLUDE TREATMENT FOR OTHER SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS (STIMULANT, TOBACCO, ALCOHOL USE), INTERFACE WITH SPECIALTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE--SPECIFICALLY CHILD AND ADOLESCENT PSYCHIATRY, AND PROVIDE CRISIS INTERVENTION CLINICAL EXPERIENCE WITH OUR LOCAL MENTAL HEALTH AUTHORITY.  IN ADDITION TO THE TIME-BOUND CLINICAL PROGRAMS, THERE WILL BE FORMAL TRAINING IN TEAM-BASED CARE IN RESIDENCY CONTINUITY CLINICS TO GROW DIDACTIC AND TEAM-BASED INSTRU CTION IN HIGH-FUNCTIONING ASPECTS OF TEAMS FOR RESIDENTS AND STAFF.  WE ALSO INTEND TO EXPAND DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL INSTRUCTION IN MEASUREMENT-BASED CARE.  DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: -	BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND PEDIATRIC OUTPATIENT ROTATIONS, CHILD AND ADOLESCENT PSYCHIATRY AND PRIMARY CARE ADDICTION MEDICINE CLINICAL EXPERIENCES -	PROVIDE TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE AND GUN VIOLENCE PREVENTION/RESPONSE TRAINING EXPERIENCES -	TEAM-/MEASUREMENT-BASED CARE WORKSHOP SESSIONS (USING PURPOSE BUILT CURRICULA) -	DECISION SUPPORT TOOLS SPECIFICALLY ADDRESSING ADOLESCENT PATIENTS  MEASURABLES/DATA TRACKED WILL INCLUDE: 1)	RESIDENT PARTICIPATION THROUGHOUT THEIR TRAINING PERIOD DATA (START DATE, COMPLETION OF PROGRAM COMPONENTS, GRADUATION DATE, DUTY HOURS REPORTING FOR VARIOUS CLINICAL ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE PROJECT) 2)	WORKSHOP INFORMATION (TITLES, PRESENTERS, DATES, AND ATTENDEES) 3)	RESIDENT IN TRAINING EXAM SCORES FOR BEHAVIORAL HEALTH DOMAINS 4)	DEVELOPING AND TRACKING ENDURING EDUCATIONAL CONTENT 5)	GRADUATE EMPLOYMENT DATA (LOCATION, PRACTICE TYPE, MUC, AND HPSA STATUSES).    THE PROGRAM AND ITS DATA TRACKING WILL BE LED BY ZACH SARTOR, MD, WITH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND CLINICAL SUPPORT FROM ADDITIONAL KEY/SENIOR FACULTY, STAFF, AND EXPERIENCED, RECOGNIZED CONSULTANTS.  MOST PROPOSED PROGRAM ALTERATIONS WILL OCCUR INTERNALLY WITHIN THE WACO FAMILY MEDICINE SYSTEM.  ALL THE TRAINING EXPERIENCES PROPOSED WILL FOCUS ON THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES AS NECESSARY FOR BEHAVIORAL HEALTH DISORDERS THROUGHOUT THE LIFESPAN – INCLUDING CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS.  THE LEARNING PROCESS WILL PRIMARILY BE EXPERIENTIAL, WITH INTENTIONAL DIDACTIC INSTRUCTION FROM WITHIN OUR ORGANIZATION AND IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OTHERS TO ACHIEVE THE TRAINING NECESSARY TO PROVIDE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, AND TREATMENT OF BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS. WITH SUPPORT FROM THE PCTE-RTMB PROGRAM, THE HEALTH SYSTEM WILL PROVIDE DIDACTIC CURRICULA AND CLINICAL ROTATIONS IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH BY FORMING NEW AND EXPANDING EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS. THESE PARTNERSHIPS WILL STRENGTHEN FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS’ TRAINING IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS FOR RURAL, AT-RISK POPULATIONS IN SOUTHWEST MISSOURI.  THIS WORK IS SYNERGISTIC WITH NEW ACGME REQUIREMENTS FOR FAMILY MEDICINE AND WILL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING MEASURABLE OBJECTIVES: 1	GRADUATE FIFTEEN (15) FAMILY MEDICINE PHYSICIANS WITH EXPERIENCE PRACTICING BEHAVIORAL AND MENTAL HEALTH IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES BY JULY 2027. 2	DEVELOP OR EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS WITH TEN (10) BEHAVIORAL/MENTAL HEALTH AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS BY JUNE 2023. 3	INITIATE THREE (3) DEDICATED BEHAVIORAL AND MENTAL HEALTH ROTATIONS IN PARTNERSHIP WITH OZARK CENTER (CCBHO) BY DECEMBER 2023. 4	ENHANCE BEHAVIORAL/MENTAL HEALTH CONTENT IN NINE (9) TRAINING BLOCKS FOR FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS BY PARTNER WITH CONTENT EXPERTS: ALIVE & WELL COMMUNITIES, HEALTH LITERACY MEDIA, THE CARE PARTNER NETWORK, NEOSHO & MCDONALD COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOL DISTRICTS, REFUGEE & IMMIGRANT SERVICES AND EDUCATION (RAISE).   LED BY DR. MILLER AND GUIDED BY A PATIENT ADVISORY COUNCIL, THIS 5-YEAR PROJECT LEVERAGE A ROBUST, INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM TO ENGAGE EXPERTS IN ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EVENTS (ACES), TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE, HEALTH LITERACY, HEALTH EQUITY, MINORITY POPULATIONS, SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER TREATMENT, HEALTH-RELATED SOCIAL NEEDS REFERRALS, AND JUVENILE JUSTICE. THE PROGRAM WILL ENHANCE EXISTING TRAINING MODALITIES, BOTH DIDACTIC AND EXPERIENTIAL, AS WELL AS DEVELOP NEW TRAINING MATERIALS AND PATHWAYS. FAMILY MEDICINE AND PSYCHIATRY RESIDENTS WILL WORK IN INTERDI SCIPLINARY TEAMS, ALONG WITH A LICENSED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL AND COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER WHO PROVIDE THE FAMILY MEDICINE PROGRAM CONTINUITY CLINIC WITH WHOLE-PERSON CARE.  A FUNDING PREFERENCE IS REQUESTED BASED ON THE FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY MEETING THE HRSA DEFINITION OF A NEW PROGRAM. A FUNDING PRIORITY IS ALSO REQUESTED BASED ON ITS PRACTICE IN RURAL, UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - ADDRESS: CHILDREN’S HOSPITAL LOS ANGELES, 4650 SUNSET BLVD MS #76, LA, CA 90027  PROJECT DIRECTOR NAME: CHRISTINE MIRZAIAN, MD, MPH  CONTACT PHONE NUMBERS: (P) 323-361-2759; (F) 323-361-4429 EMAIL ADDRESS: CMIRZAIAN@CHLA.USC.EDU  WEBSITE ADDRESS: HTTPS://WWW.CHLA.ORG/ GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS REQUESTED IN THE APPLICATION: $2,500,000  OVERVIEW: THERE IS A NEED TO TRAIN THE NEXT GENERATION OF PRIMARY CARE PEDIATRICIANS TO ADDRESS MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH. THIS COMMUNITY-PARTNERED PROJECT AIMS TO ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PRIMARY CARE PEDIATRICIANS IN CULTURALLY-COMPETENT IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, AND TREATMENT, FOR CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS WITH MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS FROM CULTURALLY DIVERSE, UNDER-RESOURCED COMMUNITIES. THIS PROGRAM WILL EXPAND TRAINING OF PEDIATRIC RESIDENTS AT CHILDREN’S HOSPITAL LOS ANGELES THROUGH COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS IN AREAS SIGNIFICANTLY IMPACTED BY HEALTH INEQUITIES RELATED TO SOCIAL AND DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH. GOAL 1: TO ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PRIMARY CARE PEDIATRICIANS IN THE CARE OF CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS WITH MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS INCLUDING THOSE AT-RISK FOR, OR THOSE EXPERIENCING, ABUSE, TRAUMA AND SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS AND INCLUDING THOSE WITH INTELLECTUAL OR DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITIES AND CO-OCCURRING MENTAL HEALTH CONDITIONS. OBJECTIVE 1: INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PEDIATRICIANS (50 PEDIATRIC ATTENDINGS AND 190 PEDIATRIC RESIDENTS) WHO ARE TRAINED IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS IN YEARS 1-5. OBJECTIVE 2: EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS WITH INTEGRATED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND PRIMARY CARE SETTINGS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO PROVIDE CLINICAL ROTATIONS, VIA AN INTEGRATED PRIMARY CARE AND COMMUNITY-BASED MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH LONGITUDINAL ROTATION, GREATER THAN THE EQUIVALENT OF ONE-MONTH IN DURATION FOR PRIMARY CARE PEDI ATRIC RESIDENTS IN YEARS 1-5.  OBJECTIVE 3: DEVELOP AND ENHANCE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONTENT IN DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL TRAINING, VIA AN INTEGRATED PRIMARY CARE AND COMMUNITY-BASED MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH LONGITUDINAL ROTATION FOR PRIMARY CARE PEDIATRIC RESIDENTS IN YEARS 1-5. METHODOLOGY: IN ORDER TO MEET THE ABOVE OBJECTIVES, WE WILL, IN YEARS 1-5: 1.1. PROVIDE FOCUSED TRAINING OF PEDIATRIC PRIMARY CARE FACULTY IN DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS (20 FACULTY TOTAL) 1.2. HAVE 4 PEDIATRIC FACULTY DEVELOPMENT/DIDACTIC SESSIONS PER YEAR FOCUSING ON MEDICATION TREATMENT OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS AND MEDICATION FOR OPIOID USE DISORDERS (MOUD)  (30 FACULTY MEMBERS TOTAL).   2.1. EMBED A MENTAL HEALTH PRECEPTOR INTO THE  RESIDENT PRIMARY CARE CONTINUITY CLINIC. 2.2. PROVIDE SUICIDE PREVENTION TRAINING MODULE  3.6. PROVIDE ACES SCREENING, TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE TRAINING SESSION. 3.7. PROVIDE MOTIVATIONAL INTERVIEWING TRAINING SESSIONS.  3.8. DREW UNIVERSITY OF MEDICINE AND SCIENCE (CDU), COLLEGE OF MEDICINE (COM) PROPOSES TO CREATE THE COMMUNITY-FOCUSED MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH TRAINING FOR FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS PROGRAM. THIS PROGRAM WILL ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF FAMILY MEDICINE PHYSICIANS SO THEY CAN IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS AMONG CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS (29 YEARS AND YOUNGER), ESPECIALLY PEOPLE OF COLOR AND THOSE EXPERIENCING TRAUMA IN HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED URBAN COMMUNITIES. AS A MINORITY-SERVING INSTITUTION, CDU IS WELL SUITED TO TRAIN AND EDUCATE RESIDENTS TO ADDRESS THIS TARGET POPULATION: IT HAS A LONG HISTORY PROVIDING HEALTH CARE THAT IS CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT AND THAT PROMOTES SOCIAL JUSTICE AND HEALTH EQUITY. THE PROPOSED PROGRAM WILL BE INCORPORATED INTO THE THREE-YEAR FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAM; PHYSICIANS WILL BEGIN LEARNING FOUNDATIONAL PRINCIPLES IN YEAR 1, APPLYING KNOWLEDGE IN YEAR 2, AND GAINING MASTERY IN YEAR 3. TO ENSURE FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS WILL BE EXPOSED TO CLINICAL AND SCHOLARLY EXPERIENCES WHERE THEY MAY IDENTIFY AND ADDRESS MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS, COLLEGE OF MEDICINE (COM) WILL PARTNER WITH CDU-AFFILIATED, INTEGRATED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND PRIMARY CARE CLINICS AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS WHO WORK WITH CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS WHO ARE UNHOUSED, IN THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM, AND IN SCHOOL-BASED SETTINGS. THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PROGRAM IS TO ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES:   OBJECTIVE 1. FOUND ATIONAL PRINCIPLES: ENHANCE FOUNDATIONAL CONTENT OF THE EXISTING POST GRADUATE YEAR 1 (PGY1) FAMILY MEDICINE INTRODUCTORY DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL ROTATION, COMMUNITY-FOCUSED MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH 1.0, TO INCLUDE CHILD AND ADOLESCENT MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER (SUD) TREATMENT, AND WELLNESS WITH A FOCUS ON ADOLESCENTS AND YOUNG ADULTS, ESPECIALLY PEOPLE OF COLOR AND THOSE EXPERIENCING TRAUMA IN HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED URBAN COMMUNITIES.  OBJECTIVE 2. APPLIED KNOWLEDGE: CREATE A NEW PGY2 FAMILY MEDICINE COMMUNITY-FOCUSED MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH 2.0 ROTATION TO APPLY CLINICAL, DIDACTIC, AND SCHOLARLY TRAINING IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT OF, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS (INCLUDING SUD) FOR CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS, AND YOUNG ADULTS (29 YEARS AND YOUNGER), ESPECIALLY PEOPLE OF COLOR AND THOSE EXPERIENCING TRAUMA IN HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED URBAN COMMUNITIES.  OBJECTIVE 3. COMPETENCY/MASTERY TO TEACH OTHERS: CREATE A NEW PGY3 FAMILY MEDICINE COMMUNITY-FOCUSED MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH 3.0 ROTATION TO DEMONSTRATE MASTERY OF CLINICAL, DIDACTIC, AND SCHOLARLY EXPERIENCES (INCLUDING SUICIDE PREVENTION, TRAUMA-INFORMED CARE, AND SUD TREATMENT) SERVING CHILDREN, ADOLESCENTS AND YOUNG ADULTS (29 YEARS AND YOUNGER), ESPECIALLY PEOPLE OF COLOR AND THOSE EXPERIENCING TRAUMA IN HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED URBAN COMMUNITIES.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY AND COMMUNITY MEDICINE AT THE KIRK KERKORIAN SCHOOL OF MEDICINE AT UNLV IS APPLYING FOR A PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT-RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH (PCTE-RTMB) GRANT TO SUPPORT TRAINING RESIDENT PHYSICIANS IN OUR RURAL AND URBAN FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY PROGRAMS. THE TRAINING WILL FOCUS ON PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERVICES FOR MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS FOR PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT, YOUNG ADULT, AND VULNERABLE POPULATIONS (E.G., COLLEGE ATHLETES, INDIVIDUALS AT-RISK OR HAVE EXPERIENCED ABUSE, TRAUMA, OR MENTAL HEALTH AND/OR SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS, GUN VIOLENCE, AND INDIVIDUALS WITH DISABILITIES AND AUTISM SPECTRUM DISORDERS). WE REQUEST FUNDING PREFERENCE BASED ON AN MUC PLACEMENT RATE OVER 50% FOR BOTH PROGRAMS (ATTACHMENT 7) AND FUNDING PRIORITY FOR OUR RESIDENCY PROGRAMS TRAINING RESIDENTS IN RURAL AREAS, MAINTAINING CONTINUED ACCREDITATION, AND ROTATING AT RURAL CLINIC SITES (ATTACHMENTS 9, 1, AND 4).   THE NEVADA FAMILY MEDICINE: BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ENHANCEMENT PROJECT (NV FAMILY MEDICINE BHEP) ADDRESSES ACCESS, SAFETY, TELEHEALTH, MENTAL HEALTH, SUBSTANCE USE, SUICIDE PREVENTION, TRAUMA INFORMED CARE, AND PARTNERSHIPS THROUGH CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE EVIDENCE-BASED COURSES AND ADVANCED CLINICAL EXPERIENCES TO ENABLE GRADUATES TO DEVELOP COMPETENCIES. THE AT-RISK PATIENT POPULATIONS SERVED INCLUDE THE COMPLETE LIFE-CYCLE WITH A FOCUS ON VULNERABLE PEDIATRIC AND YOUNG ADULTS OF THE SEVERELY MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AND RURAL AREAS OF HUMBOLDT, PERSHING, LANDER AND CLARK COUNTIES IN NEVADA. NEVADA CURRENTLY RANKS 39 IN HEALTHCARE AND THE RURAL AREAS ARE UNDERSERVED EVEN RELATIVE TO THE REST OF THE STATE.  TRAINING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF NATIONAL STANDARDIZED SCREENING TOOLS SUCH AS SCREENING, BRIEF INTERVENTION, AND REFERRAL TO TREATMENT, WILL ENHANCE CLINICAL CARE. INNOVATION OF NEW MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH DELIVERED TH ROUGH GRADUATE MEDICAL EDUCATION-BASED PROJECT ECHO AND PODCASTS WILL PROVIDE ENHANCED EDUCATION WITHOUT WALLS, IN TURN STRENGTHENING ACADEMIC AND COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS. PARTICIPATION IN INTER-PROFESSIONAL SIMULATION IS DESIGNED TO IMPROVE TEACHING TECHNIQUES FOR SENSITIVE PATIENT INTERACTIONS WITH VULNERABLE POPULATIONS.  PRIMARY DATA DERIVED KNOWLEDGE AND CLINICAL SKILL ASSESSMENTS WILL DETERMINE CURRICULAR EFFECTIVENESS.   THE PROJECT WILL FEATURE COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE DEPARTMENT OF FAMILY AND COMMUNITY MEDICINE AND OTHER SCHOOL OF MEDICINE DEPARTMENTS, UNLV ATHLETICS AND STUDENT WELLNESS PROGRAMS, AND COMMUNITY PARTNER HOSPITALS IN THE MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS AND RURAL AREA, HUMBOLDT GENERAL HOSPITAL AND COMMUNITY CLINICS UNDERPINNED BY THE NEVADA STATE OFFICE OF RURAL HEALTH, OUR COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS INVOLVED IN SOCIAL CHANGE SUCH AS THE NATIONAL MUSIC TO LIFE. THE PROJECT WILL PRIMARILY SUPPORT AND IMPACT UNLV FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS AND FACULTY, BUT WILL ALSO BENEFIT PEDIATRIC AND INTERNAL MEDICINE RESIDENCIES, OTHER FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENTS AND PHYSICIANS IN THE COMMUNITY, AND PATIENTS IN ALL OF THE COMMUNITIES SERVED.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - THE GREENFIELD FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH PROJECT IS A COLLABORATION BETWEEN THE UMASS CHAN MEDICAL SCHOOL-BAYSTATE GREENFIELD FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY (GFMR) AND THE DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHIATRY TO ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS BY TRAINING PRIMARY CARE FAMILY MEDICINE (FM) RESIDENTS IN THE PROVISION OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH (MBH) CARE FOR PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT, AND YOUNG ADULT POPULATIONS. FUNDING WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT BOTH DIDACTIC TRAINING AND CLINICAL ROTATIONS TO MEET THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES:   OBJECTIVE #1: PROVIDE DIDACTIC TRAINING IN MBH CARE FOR PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT, AND YOUNG ADULTS.  OBJECTIVE #2: PROVIDE A REQUIRED MONTH-LONG CLINICAL ROTATION IN MBH.  OBJECTIVE #3: DEVELOP NEW AND ENHANCE EXISTING MBH PARTNERSHIPS AT CLINICAL ROTATION SITES.  OBJECTIVE #4: SUPPORT COMMUNITY-BASED PRECEPTORS FOR THE REQUIRED MBH CLINICAL ROTATIONS.  OBJECTIVE #5: PROVIDE FACULTY DEVELOPMENT TO MBH FACULTY/PRECEPTORS.  OBJECTIVE #6: INCORPORATE A LONGITUDINAL INTEGRATED MBH CURRICULUM INTO THE RESIDENTS 3-YEAR LONG CONTINUITY CLINIC.   OBJECTIVE #7: DEVELOP AN EXPERIENCE IN EDUCATIONAL AND JUVENILE JUSTICE FOR ALL RESIDENTS.  OBJECTIVE #8: TRAIN RESIDENTS IN THE USE OF MEDICATIONS FOR OPIOID USE DISORDERS.  OBJECTIVE #9: DEVELOP A NEW CLINICAL ROTATION DEDICATED TO THE CARE OF PATIENTS WITH SUBSTANCE USE DISORDER.  OBJECTIVE #10: PROVIDE AN ANNUAL CONTINUING PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT (CME) PROGRAM ON MBH TOPICS FOR PRACTICING PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS.    OBJECTIVE #11: COLLECT POST-GRADUATION EMPLOYMENT DEMOGRAPHICS OF RESIDENCY GRADUATES. 1. THE PROJECT WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED BY THE BAYSTATE HEALTH (BH) DEPARTMENTS OF FAMILY MEDICINE (FM) AND PSYCHIATRY FACULTY AND STAFF, INCLUDING THE FOLLOWING: - THE GFMR PROGRAM DIRECTOR AND THE GFMR PROGRAM COORDINATOR, WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH CHAIR OF THE BH DEPARTMENT OF PSYCHIATRY AND DIVISION OF CHILD PSYCHIATRY CHIEF TO DEVELOP MBH DIDA CTIC TOPICS AND IDENTIFY EXPERT FACULTY.   - THE BPM/GFM MEDICAL DIRECTOR, WILL ENSURE THAT RESIDENTS HAVE A CONTINUITY PRACTICE AND ARE APPROPRIATELY TRAINED AND PRECEPTED TO PROVIDE MAT FOR PATIENTS WITH OUD. - THE FM DEPARTMENT CHAIR WILL WORK CLOSELY WITH HIS COUNTERPART IN PSYCHIATRY TO PROVIDE PRECEPTOR HONORARIA AND FACULTY DEVELOPMENT; AND TO SPONSOR AN ANNUAL BMH CME PROGRAM. - THE FM DEPARTMENT CHAIR WILL ASSUME RESPONSIBILITY FOR TRACKING OUTCOMES. - THE GFMR PROGRAM COORDINATOR, AN EXPERIENCED ADMINISTRATOR, WILL ASSIST WITH GRANT ADMINISTRATION AND MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES. 3. THE GREENFIELD FAMILY MEDICINE RESIDENCY (GFMR), A (4-4-4), THREE-YEAR LONG ACGME ACCREDITED PRIMARY CARE TRAINING PROGRAM WILL BE THE MAIN BENEFICIARY OF THIS PROJECT. 4. THIS REQUEST INCLUDES A FUNDING PRIORITY, AS GFMR TRAINS RESIDENTS IN A FRANKLIN COUNTY, WHERE THE RESIDENTS TRAIN FOR OVER 90% OF THEIR TIME, A DESIGNATED RURAL AREA. THE SPONSORING HOSPITAL (BAYSTATE FRANKLIN MEDICAL CENTER) AND THE FAMILY MEDICINE PRACTICE (BMP/GFM) ARE LOCATED IN GREENFIELD (THE COUNTY SEAT).  5. THIS REQUEST ALSO INCLUDES A FUNDING PREFERENCE AS A NEW PROGRAM AS WE WELCOMED OUR INAUGURAL COHORT OF RESIDENTS IN JULY 2022 AND ANTICIPATE GRADUATING OUR FIRST CLASS IN JUNE 2025! IN ADDITION, WE MEET ALL OF THE LISTED CRITERIA, RELATED TO TRAINING IN A MUC.

PRIMARY CARE TRAINING AND ENHANCEMENT - RESIDENCY TRAINING IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH - TULANE INTERNAL MEDICINE-PEDIATRICS RESIDENCY PROGRAM 1430 TULANE AVENUE #8016, NEW ORLEANS, LA 70112 HTTPS://MEDICINE.TULANE.EDU/INTERNAL-MEDICINE-PEDIATRICS-RESIDENCY/PROGRAM JESSICA DEBORD, MD/MPH: (504) 988-1332, JEBORD@TULANE.EDU  TOTAL FUNDS REQUESTED: $2,500,000  THE BAYOU BRIDGES PROGRAM IS AN INITIATIVE OF THE TULANE INTERNAL MEDICINE-PEDIATRICS (MED-PEDS) RESIDENCY PROGRAM, IN COLLABORATION WITH THE SCHOOL OF SOCIAL WORK, ADDICTION MEDICINE FELLOWSHIP, SECTION OF CHILD & ADOLESCENT PSYCHIATRY, AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. THE PURPOSE IS TO ADDRESS GROWING DISPARITIES IN ACCESS TO MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CARE BY TRAINING PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS IN THE PREVENTION, IDENTIFICATION, DIAGNOSIS, TREATMENT, AND REFERRAL OF SERIES FOR MENTAL HEALTH AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS FOR PEDIATRIC, ADOLESCENT, YOUNG ADULT, AND OTHER POPULATIONS WHO ARE AT-RISK OR HAVE EXPERIENCES ABUSE, TRAUMA, OR MENTAL HEALTH AND/OR SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS (SUD), INCLUDING THOSE RELATED TO THE EFFECTS OF GUN VIOLENCE. THE NEW ORLEANS AREA HAS INADEQUATE MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH INFRASTRUCTURE TO FULFILL NEED. SUBSTANCE ABUSE AND VIOLENCE ARE INCREASING IN OUR REGION; DRUG DEATHS WERE UP 56% IN NEW ORLEANS IN 2021, AND MORE THAN HALF OF CHILDREN RESIDING IN ONE NEIGHBORHOOD IN CENTRAL NEW ORLEANS HAVE HAD SOMEONE CLOSE TO THEM MURDERED. THE BAYOU BRIDGES PROGRAM AIMS TO INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS WHO ARE TRAINED IN THE MANAGEMENT OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS THROUGH THE INTRODUCTION OF A NEW INTEGRATED MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CURRICULUM FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS. TULANE MED-PEDS WILL DEVELOP AND EXPAND PARTNERSHIPS WITH INTEGRATED BEHAVIORAL HEALTH AND PRIMARY CARE SETTINGS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS TO CREATE THE CURRICULUM, WHICH WILL INCLUDE BOTH TRAININGS AND EXPERIENTIAL LEARNING, INCLUDING CLINICAL ROTATIONS OF AT LEAST ONE MONTH IN DURATION THAT ADDRESS TOPICS INCLUDING SUICIDE PREVENTION AND  TRAUMA INFORMED CARE, INCLUDING ABUSE AND GUN VIOLENCE, THE MANAGEMENT OF SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS, INCLUDING MEDICATION FOR OPIOID USE DISORDER, SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH, HEALTH LITERACY, AND HEALTH EQUITY. EVIDENCE-BASED CONTENT WILL BE INTRODUCED THROUGH INTERACTIVE AND RELEVANT TRAININGS LEAD BY CONTENT EXPERTS, THEN REINFORCED THROUGH CLINICAL EXPERIENCES. WEEKLY MULTI-DISCIPLINARY CONFERENCES WILL FACILITATE REFLECTION AND CONSOLIDATION OF CONTENT. ALL PROGRAM ACTIVITIES WILL BE GUIDED BY THE GOAL AND OBJECTIVES OF HRSA AND THE BAYOU BRIDGES PROGRAM. THROUGHOUT THE PROCESS OF CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT, IMPLEMENTATION, EVALUATION, AND DISSEMINATION, THE BAYOU BRIDGES TEAM WILL MAINTAIN A FOCUS ON IMPROVING HEALTH EQUITY FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH MENTAL AND/OR BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CONDITIONS, AND WILL TAKE A TRAUMA-INFORMED APPROACH THAT CONSIDERS THE HIGH RATES OF VIOLENCE, ABUSE, AND RESULTING TRAUMA IN THE PEOPLE OF NEW ORLEANS. ALL MATERIALS WITH BE REVIEWED BY THE PROGRAM EQUITY, DIVERSITY, AND INCLUSION EXPERT TO ENSURE THEY ARE CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE. TULANE MED-PEDS RESIDENTS WILL BEGIN THE BAYOU BRIDGES ROTATION IN JULY 2023; 24 MED-PEDS RESIDENTS WILL COMPLETE A 1-MONTH ROTATION BY JULY 2024, AT WHICH TIME THE ROTATION WILL BE OPENED TO RESIDENTS IN INTERNAL MEDICINE, PEDIATRICS, AND FAMILY MEDICINE. BAYOU BRIDGES WILL ENROLL 24 NEW RESIDENTS EACH ACADEMIC YEAR. BY THE END OF THE GRANT PERIOD THE PROGRAM WILL HAVE TRAINED 120 PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH. THE TULANE MED-PEDS BAYOU BRIDGES PROGRAM IS AN INNOVATIVE, DATA-INFORMED APPROACH THAT WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PRIMARY CARE PHYSICIANS WHO ARE TRAINED IN MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH THROUGH THE DEVELOPMENT AND EXPANSION OF PARTNERSHIPS TO CREATE DIDACTIC AND CLINICAL TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR PRIMARY CARE RESIDENTS. WE ARE REQUESTING A FUNDING PREFERENCE UNDER QUALIFICATION 1: HIGH MUC PLACEMENT RATE.
